website_summaries.verdict: Clamp this blender to your table for fresh smoothies and other beverages when you're camping or tailgating.
pros: 1.5 liter pitcher made from durable Lexan resin
Made of plastic, metal, and stainless steel
cons: Blends liquids well and chops softer foods, but hard vegetables and ice cubes are problematic

customer_reviews.title: Hand crank blender
customer_reviews.text: Watch the video review it will all so very sorry on YouTube
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a serious blender
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea but it is to hard to crank at the high speed gear and I didn't try it out till past the return date. So I'm screwed with a product that doesn't work. I got this as a backup to my blender in case of power outage as I have to blend all my food because I'm on a feeding tube. I blend real food and not just processed junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my plug in blender
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender for living in an off the grid cabin, ended up loving it more than my plug in blenders now that I am back in civilization. I have a Viking professional and a Nutri bullet gathering dust. I blend lots of frozen fruit, it’s amazing how the gearing allows you to break through the ice. It really is just fun to crank. It’s fairly indestructible, the base fits inside the the blender pitcher, and is less noisy than a regular blender. I have taken it down multiple intense rafting trips and it has not let me down. It’s pretty incredible that you can have blended margaritas in the absolute middle of nowhere.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Bull

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our off grid Belize house
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this blender in 2011 for our off grid eco house in Belize and it’s a game day blender. I make rum drinks with it using fresh cut pineapple, bananas, OJ, ice and of course- the rum! Guests at our house have commented on how fun and easy it is to use. We gifted this blender to local friends and got one for our backyard in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila R.

customer_reviews.title: Lacks the power/leverage/whatever to crush ice.
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably well thought out design, it just doesn't do what I want it to do. I'd hoped to be able to use it to make Margaritas when camping. Alas, ice tends to jam up the works hard. I imagine it would work well for fruit smoothies and such, but I have no interest there.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around and Amazon was the cheapest by quite a bit at the time (yesterday, 10/11/20) and I received it this morning! It works but the ice isn’t as smooth as a regular blender. Think course grind but it’s a wonderful blender for camping or living off the grid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Item
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's told, or else it gets the hose (lol)!!! Great item, can actually chop ice, and is very easy to setup and take apart. Would highly recommend to anyone. I use it on my RV to make margaritas and smoothies, next up salsa!!!
customer_reviews.author: Snowball

customer_reviews.title: great non electric blender!
customer_reviews.text: no power and need a blended drink like at camping or picnic? this will chop ice. not very great for making fruit or blended smoothies. but it crushes ice well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Best blender your money can buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just AMAZING! I purchased this as a gift to my cousin that hes off grid and he cannot be any happier with this product! He says this is God sent! Thank you for such amazing product. Sturdy extremely well made. Every detail was designed to perfection!
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Chyloe

customer_reviews.title: need a good secure mounting surface
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use camping so my wife can mix her morning smoothies without the need of power. I works however u need a strong mounting surface and a fairly strong arm to operate it on the fast setting speed. It did take some time to mince up spinach. All in all unit did what it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: waynes world

customer_reviews.title: It did take a lot of cranking as I like thick, smooth protein shakes
customer_reviews.text: This product has performed as it was advertized. It did blend up the crushed ice I used. It did take a lot of cranking as I like thick, smooth protein shakes. It's nice t know I can use this product without any electricity, wherever I may be.
customer_reviews.author: W in CO

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Fragile!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but a terribly fragile blender, it will broke easy, just try to prepare pesto and that’s it!
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Levy

customer_reviews.title: Off The Grid
customer_reviews.text: Good tool to have. I built a wooden wraparound so the blender would not kickout and spill while churning. Yes, the first time I did that with a spinach smoothie going everywhere. I had it chest high on my counter and it was just the right angle it shot out from my grip....and no I did not have the clamp holding the base down. So, once the operator got over being a spazz...the blender is a good sturdy off the grid tool.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd Evan White

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for frozen drinks on a  sailboat
customer_reviews.text: When used exactly as instructed- 55 turns on the top, or lower, gear, followed by 55 turns on the bottom, or higher, gear, we had frozen drinks that were excellent and of a perfectly smooth consistency. If you do not follow directions exactly, you will have tiny crushed ice in your drinks which is good too, but different.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Atwood Rice

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself the mess
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy!!! I should have read the poor reviews. I have no idea why this is rated so high: It will knock over and spill everything. If you do buy it, try it out the first time with ice and water. Save yourself the mess. Trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, sturdy and perfect. Great purchase for outdoors if there is no electricity available. Stuff to be blended must be finely chopped :)
customer_reviews.author: finla

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: The worst blender I have ever used in my entire life. Absolutely terrible product. It doesn't blend anything other than banana's, everything else just gets a bit chopped up. It can't even make soup.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Manual blender is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: I got this handy 2 speed manual blender for several reasons....regular home use, camping/traveling and potential long term grid down times. It's convenient, a good size and packs up as compactly as you could ever hope for in a blender. While it has 2 speed options for the manual winding handle, you can also adjust your winding speed to accommodate your recipe needs. The Vortex manual blender is not cheap but it does seem sturdy and I'm glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Feisty Viking

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and works just fine
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and works just fine. i wish it had a better gear ratio (faster rpms). other than that it withstood 3 years of use in the jungle. a bit noisy though....
customer_reviews.author: linas

customer_reviews.title: was really excited about this product, but after having ...
customer_reviews.text: was really excited about this product, but after having it in the same place for less than 6 months the gears have already corroded and it no longer works :'(
customer_reviews.author: Liz Krakow

customer_reviews.title: Great blended drinks without electricity!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Vortex Blender as a birthday gift and the recipient loved it. Made frothy cold pina coladas during a houseboating trip where electricity wasn't an option. All parts solidly made. Easy clean up. Recipient can't wait to use it again on an upcoming camping trip!
customer_reviews.author: J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work with ice
customer_reviews.text: basically an ice chopper. doesn't go fast enough to "blend" anything made with ice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this worked great!
customer_reviews.text: took it to the beach this weekend - worked well!!! Needs some serious cranking to get going but was very pleased with the results.....stick to smaller ice-cubes and it's almost as good as an electric blender!
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: GSI Vortex blender
customer_reviews.text: This is hard to use. It falls over and falls apart every time I use it. It is very unstable. I was disgusted with it and put it back in the box and in the basement. Too late now to return it. I am sorry I bought it. Sounded like it would be good to have when the power goes out, But is really a pain to use
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Can barely turn handle and is super load when you can
customer_reviews.text: Used it first time to make smoothie. Worked well. Second time gears must have striped or something came undone inside. Can barely turn handle and is super load when you can. They won't stand by their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley G.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: After our old blender went out, I wanted to replace with something non-electric because I figured it would last longer and obviously save energy. I had really high hopes for this, but was disappointed in the performance. I think this would be fine if you are only wanting to use it to mix liquids, but anything with a thicker consistency just doesn't blend. I thought that maybe I just wasn't strong enough or something, but I've had several other people try it out for me with the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for daiquiris with the recommend mix ratio
customer_reviews.text: It works, just a little differently from an electric blender. Follow the recipe book ratio of 2 cups liquid + 4 cups ice. When using warm ice (32F) from an ice chest it works fine. When using cold ice from the freezer (0F) the mix was too solid to blend well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the quality of the product and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality of the product and the quick delivery. The only drawback is the inability to crush ice cubes - maybe we haven't figured out exactly how to do it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Benedict W Howes

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well this works! It makes awesome smoothies!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have purchased. Gave the other as a gift. It is awesome for tailgate parties or camping. Margaritas never tasted so good! Also makes great salsa and other things which need to be chopped! The only complaint is that the handle does not store inside the cup along with the base. Otherwise good build quality and plastic cup is heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: Great blender
customer_reviews.text: Love the blender! It works great, and just as good as one running on electricity
customer_reviews.author: Kindle-klant

customer_reviews.title: The Vortex is the bomb!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blender, & not only for people going camping off-grid, but helps by being Green! We love it. Only difference is the ice-chopping--doesn't do as well. 4 1/2 stars out of 5...
customer_reviews.author: Z...23227

customer_reviews.title: mix away
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to do at first until you get the hang of it. Mixes well. Will be great if you want to live totally off the grid.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Johsnon

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: It actually became like a work out just to try and blend anything on this. It needs two people to blend, and it doesn't liquefy. The product is a bad invention from my perspective.
customer_reviews.author: venichhe

customer_reviews.title: GSI Vortex
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it. Stored it. But a thorough examination shows the product is reasonably well made and sturdy enough, considering (most lower, chintzy) modern standards. Called the company with questions prior to purchase. I was assured it will handle nut and seed drinks as long as adequate liquid has been added. Hope this is the real thing!
customer_reviews.author: xyz

customer_reviews.title: Great For Power Failures
customer_reviews.text: The blender arrived just in time for our second power failure in a week It chopped ice, mixed semi frozen orange juice and blended protein powder and milk without problem. It will be great for car camping and picnicking where a flat surface is available to clamp the plender.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: tried to use once
customer_reviews.text: A bit to Tall & Skinny. My strong hubby & I had to hold it down (clammed) so it wouldn't go flying across the table. Don't try to chop kale or anything not MUSHY. The blade is pretty pittyful.
customer_reviews.author: jessica mccann

customer_reviews.title: Works great, even with ice
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area that is prone to power outages during winter storms. I purchased this unit so that I could make breakfast shakes in case of power loss. Upon testing it, I discovered this unit works very well. I even threw in some ice cubes into the shake and it had no problem grinding them up. I've already recommended this unit to friends, and would do business with this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Shay

customer_reviews.title: Works well but the trim piece next to where the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the trim piece next to where the handle attaches to the blender won't stay attached to the body. This unit works well for making frozen margaritas on the river!
customer_reviews.author: Scott ledin

customer_reviews.title: could be more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: i love that it can go anywhere and doesn't use electricity. I am a little dissapointed in the quality too many plastic parts for true tailgating and packing. it would be nice if the actual vessel was made out of metal, it would last longer, other than that it blends great and is easy to set up and use!
customer_reviews.author: eileen

customer_reviews.title: GSI Outdoors Vortex Hand Blender
customer_reviews.text: My GSI Vortex blender has become an indespensible kitchen tool on my camping equipment list. From smoothies and sauces to omelets and pan cakes, there are several tasks made easier and it cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Poohpa

product_meta.title: GSI Outdoors Vortex Blender
product_meta.description: FEATURES of the GSI Outdoors Vortex Blender Powerful, two speed gear system crushes ice or works as a food processor Durable 1.5 L pitcher and shot cap made of tough BPA Free resin Exclusive pour-through locking lid design Wide base and C-clamp secure the blender to any table help to prevent accidents
feature_bullets: NO ELECTRICITY, NO PROBLEM: The Vortex Blender is perfect for blending up tasty margaritas, healthy smoothies, protein shakes, sauces, pancake batter and more without the need for an outlet. The blender’s hand crank activates a powerful 2-speed gear system to crush ice or blend drinks!
DURABLE DESIGN: This 1.5-liter pitcher and lid is made from virtually unbreakable, easy-to-clean Lexan resin, perfect for even your most adventurous outings.
AVOID THE MESS: Prevent accidents and spills with the blender’s exclusive pour-through locking lid and its C-clamp that secures its wide base to any table.
COMPACT AND CONVENIENT: Measuring 6.5 x 10.3 x 5.7 inches and weighing only 4 pounds 12 ounces, the Vortex Blender is perfect for on-site camping activities.

LIFETIME PROMISE: GSI Outdoors spent over 30 years building quality, performance products and stands behind them 100%. GSI Outdoors warranties all products for the original owner against manufacturing defects for the lifetime of the product.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
